intro: Franciscea pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered franciscea, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and chaparral habitats.
